byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Mersin and Urfa, Turkey; Kamil Kakol from Erbil and Sulaimaniya, Iraq; and Salomea Krobath from Vienna and Eisenstadt, Austria.

abstract: Discovery of bodies of 71 migrants in truck near Hungarian border in August exposes cruel tactics that smugglers use to exploit vulnerable and desperate refugees; families of dead say many of migrants were affluent and educated, and did not start out naive or helpless, highlighting level of skilled manipulation smugglers are using to exploit even most resourceful and educated migrants.
lead_paragraph: The deaths of 71 migrants in a meat truck found in Austria raised questions about the cruelty of the smugglers and the desperation of their clients.

headline.main: Migrant Suffocations in Truck Near Hungary Reveal Tactics of Smugglers
headline.print_headline: Migrant Deaths Reveal Tactics of Smugglers

snippet: The deaths of 71 migrants in a meat truck found in Austria raised questions about the cruelty of the smugglers and the desperation of their clients.
